definition: combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

definition: phonetic component of a Chinese character
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
